com.pump.swing

Class CollapsibleContainer

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • com.pump.swing.SectionContainer
              • com.pump.swing.CollapsibleContainer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class CollapsibleContainer
extends SectionContainer
    A vertical series of collapsible, labeled Sections.

    Each Section has an optional vertical weight (the default is assumed to be zero). This determines how vertical space is distributed. If a Section has zero weight, then it is given its preferred size (but never any more).

    Each header is a JButton. By default the user can click each header to make it toggle its collapsed state. This can also be achieved by directly calling: header.putClientProperty(COLLAPSED, bool). Also you can call header.putClientProperty(COLLAPSIBLE, false) to prevent the user from toggling the collapsed state. (But you can still programmatically alter it.)

    The CollapsibleContainerDemoHelper creates this animation showing off this demo app:

    TODO: in addition to a weight-based model, we also need an alternative priority-based model. As a use case: consider a gap that has a priority of 1, and a scrollpane that has a priority of 2.

    See Also:

    • Field Detail

      • HEADER

        protected static final java.lang.String HEADER
        A property name for a Section that maps to the JButton used as a header for that Section.

      • VERTICAL_WEIGHT

        public static final java.lang.String VERTICAL_WEIGHT
        A property name for a Section that identifies its vertical weight. When it is absent the vertical weight is assumed to be zero.

      • COLLAPSIBLE

        public static final java.lang.String COLLAPSIBLE
        A client property name for the JButton header of a Section that determines whether a the user can collapse/expand a section.

      • COLLAPSED

        public static final java.lang.String COLLAPSED
        A client property name for the JButton header of a Section that determines whether a Section is collapsed.

      • ROTATION

        protected static final java.lang.String ROTATION
        A client property name for the JButton header of a Section that determines the current rotation of the triangle. (This will vary a lot during animation.)

      • TARGET_ROTATION

        protected static final java.lang.String TARGET_ROTATION
        A client property name for the JButton header of a Section that determines the target rotation of the triangle. (This is generally 1 of 2 values: open or closed.)

      • SECTION

        protected static final java.lang.String SECTION
        A client property name for the JButton header that maps to the Section this header relates to.

      • midanimation

        protected java.util.concurrent.Semaphore midanimation

    • Method Detail

        public javax.swing.JButton getHeader(SectionContainer.Section section)

      • createCollapsibleButton

        public static javax.swing.JButton createCollapsibleButton()
        Returns:
        a button that can toggle the property COLLAPSED if the property COLLAPSIBLE is true.

        This button (by default) uses a FilledButtonUI, so if you configure it's position then you can toggle off certain parts of the border.

        The following property of this button are automatically maintained through a set of listeners:

        • Request Focus Enabled
        • Focusable
        • Icon
        • COLLAPSED
        • Internal properties including ROTATION and TARGET_ROTATION

      • createCollapsibleButton

        public static javax.swing.JButton createCollapsibleButton(java.lang.String text,
                                                          boolean includeLeftAndRightEdges,
                                                          boolean collapsible)
        Parameters:
        text - the text in this button
        includeLeftAndRightEdges - whether the left and right edges should be visible
        collapsible - whether this button should initially be collapsible.
        Returns:
        a button that can toggle the property COLLAPSED if the property COLLAPSIBLE is true.

        This button (by default) uses a FilledButtonUI, so if you configure it's position then you can toggle off certain parts of the border.

        The following property of this button are automatically maintained through a set of listeners:

        • Request Focus Enabled
        • Focusable
        • Icon
        • COLLAPSED
        • Internal properties including ROTATION and TARGET_ROTATION

      • createCollapsibleButton

        protected static javax.swing.JButton createCollapsibleButton(java.lang.String text,
                                                             boolean includeLeftAndRightEdges,
                                                             boolean collapsible,
                                                             int slowDownFactor)
